intro: Cybianthus luridus, commonly known as the yellow sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Verbenaceae family and is characterized by its bright yellow flowers that bloom in summer. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. It has narrow, linear leaves and produces small, clustered inflorescences. Cybianthus luridus is often found in disturbed sites and is adapted to withstand drought and high temperatures.
